meanings.definition: The land alongside a body of water, such as a river or lake.
meanings.sent1: The ducks swam near the banks of the river.
meanings.sent2: We had a picnic by the banks of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The kids played near the river banks, pretending to be pirates.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the banks of the lake, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The lush greenery along the river banks was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Financial institutions that accept deposits and make loans.
meanings.sent1: I went to the banks to deposit my paycheck.
meanings.sent2: Many people trust banks to keep their money safe.
meanings.sent3: The bank teller accidentally gave me extra cash, making my day.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, a bank can be a lifesaver.
meanings.sent5: The bank's marble floors and high ceilings gave it a grand appearance.

meanings.definition: The sloping sides of a road or track.
meanings.sent1: The car struggled to climb the steep banks of the road.
meanings.sent2: The runners sprinted up the banks of the track.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder attempted a trick on the banks of the road.
meanings.sent4: The cyclist zoomed down the banks of the track with ease.
meanings.sent5: The banks of the road were covered in colorful flowers during the spring.
